alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 10 at 5:40AM MST until March 11 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES, AND RECEPTIVE FUELS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT SATURDAY LATE MORNING THROUGH AFTERNOON FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND EAST OF THE CENTRAL MOUNTAIN CHAIN DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES, AND RECEPTIVE FUELS... .Southwest winds will strengthen over the northeast highlands today with low relative humidity, above normal temperatures, and very dry fuels. Critical fire weather conditions are forecast for several hours during the afternoon along the I-25 corridor from near Las Vegas to Raton. Stronger west winds develop Saturday over more of the forecast area and a fire weather watch has been issued as a result. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Saturday morning through Saturday afternoon. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast plains, middle Rio Grande Valley, Central Highlands and East-central plains (Zones 104, 106, 124, 125, and 126). * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 20 to 30 mph with gusts near 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...14 to 19% * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Plains
